intro: Stachytarpheta cayennensis var. candicans, commonly known as the showy blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant blue to purple flower clusters that resemble mist. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers bloom in summer and attract a variety of pollinators, including bees and butterflies. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
